p: To control the spread of COVID-19, Rwanda instituted a raft of COVID-19 containment and mitigatory measures that ranged from enhanced hygiene by establishing handwashing stations in public places and increasing awareness through community mobilization. A countrywide lockdown was introduced after recording 17 cases only [ 5]. The country has managed to scale up the laboratory capacity for testing COVID-19, employing the pooling strategy [ 6].
